description: Progression charts: Benjamini–Hochberg correction, predictor×outcome section, sort/toggle controls, direction labels, effect size

changes.description: Researchers can now see three p-value lines on each progression chart — raw, Holm–Bonferroni, and Benjamini–Hochberg — with toggle buttons to show or hide each, sortable by any correction method. Implemented by adding a benjaminiHochberg() function to statistics.ts, computing corrected p-values per batch within each measure's progression, and rendering conditional Line components with shared toggle state.
changes.details: Hover tooltips on the toggle buttons explain each correction in plain language. The alert box explains both methods.

changes.description: Researchers can now see a collapsible Predictor × Outcome progression section that shows how p-values evolved batch-by-batch for every demographic predictor × outcome pair that is currently significant (raw p < .05 at latest batch). Implemented by adding a full predictor×outcome progression computation inside the main useMemo, applying Holm and BH corrections per pair, filtering to significant pairs, and rendering charts with the same line toggles as the measure charts.
changes.details: The section is collapsed by default and shows a count of significant pairs in the header badge.

changes.description: Each progression chart now clearly shows the direction and effect size of the latest result — a coloured pill (blue = Formal higher, amber = Informal higher) in the card title, a plain-English sentence in the description, and a Cohen's d badge with verbal interpretation below the chart. Implemented by deriving direction from the sign of Cohen's d stored per ProgressionPoint and surfacing it in the card header, description, hover tooltip, and badge row.

Clicking a row on the Responses table now reliably opens the response details in a new tab on the first click. Fixed by removing unnecessary stopPropagation from five table cells (demo, reviewed, flag, eval, early-access) whose inner buttons already handled propagation correctly, and changed row navigation to window.open(_blank).
